results.definition: the opposition or dissimilarity of things that are compared
to show differences when compared; be different
examples: the students contrast considerably in their artistic abilities

results.definition: put in opposition to show or emphasize differences
examples: The middle school teacher contrasted her best student's work with that of her weakest student

results.definition: the act of distinguishing by comparing differences
the perceptual effect of the juxtaposition of very different colors
the range of optical density and tone on a photographic negative or print (or the extent to which adjacent areas on a television screen differ in brightness)
